message: I have a product for $10000. I'm not sure if it's high-quality or low-quality, but I'm willing to let you inspect it for 1 minute. If you're still interested after inspecting it, I'll let you buy it for $10000.
I'd like to inspect the product for 1 minute. If it's high-quality, I'll buy it.

I see you're willing to take a risk on a high-quality product. Given that the last product was also low-quality, I'm not sure if you're just trying to get a good deal or if you genuinely believe in the quality of the products. I'll give you a hint: the probability of a product being high-quality is 33.33%. I'll offer you a different deal this time. I'll let you buy the product for $5000, which is a 50% discount. If you buy it, I'll also throw in a free inspection for the next product.
I'm not convinced by the hint, and I'm not willing to pay $5000 for a product with only a 33.33% chance of being high-quality. I'll pass this time.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm still hesitant to buy a product with only a 33.33% chance of being high-quality. I'll pass this time.
